title: EDocNet: Efficient Datasheet Layout Analysis Based on Focus and Global Knowledge Distillation
author: Hong Cai Chen (Affiliation not provided), Longchang Wu (Affiliation not provided), Yang Zhang (Affiliation not provided), ...
background: The task involves analyzing electronic component datasheets, which are complex documents containing varied formats and structures to extract useful information efficiently.
contribution: This paper introduces EDocNet, a deep learning model specifically designed for analyzing electronic component documents, achieving improved average precision and recall while reducing processing time.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous models like Faster R-CNN and YOLOv8 were primarily for general document types, often struggling with the complexity of electronic datasheets.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work utilizes focus and global knowledge distillation, allowing EDocNet to specialize in categorizing multiple types of document elements more effectively.

key_innovation: Incorporates a novel two-pronged distillation technique to enhance the model's ability to recognize various document layouts and components more accurately.
real_world_impact: The efficient document processing framework can significantly reduce the time engineers spend retrieving information from datasheets, thereby enhancing productivity in electronic design tasks.
limitations: No specific limitations were mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.knowledge distillation: **Knowledge distillation** is a process of transferring knowledge from a larger, typically more complex model (teacher) to a smaller, simpler model (student) to improve performance.
new_terms.focal loss: **Focal loss** is designed to address class imbalance by putting more focus on hard-to-classify examples during the training process.
